intro: Crotalaria eremicola subsp. eremicola, commonly known as the desert crownflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial with distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of desert flora.
